A Beginner’s Guide to Using ChatGPT to Generate and Upload Quizzes to Canvas

A step-by-step guide for instructors to create, format, and upload quizzes to Canvas LMS.
Published

October 22, 2023

Bureaucracy is the death of all sound work. - Albert Einstein

The Roadblock:

Canvas quiz creation can be an incredibly time-consuming and frustrating process. Manually writing questions in Canvas is clunky and soul-draining. While writing questions in a text editor and uploading them seems like an obvious solution, the upload format is prohibitively complicated. The end result is often spending hours awkwardly crafting quiz questions directly in Canvas or desperately trying to rework old quizzes. There has to be a better way to spend your limited prep time.

The Solutions:

Option 1:

If you already have a quiz and questions written, you can use ChatGPT to easily modify the formatting so you can upload your .txt file to my web app for seamless conversion. Just download the generated .zip file and import it into your Canvas course. Quiz created, just like that!

Option 2:

Let ChatGPT do the heavy lifting by generating potential quiz questions based on a list of topics or learning objectives you provide. Using my optimized prompts below, ChatGPT will provide you with questions that you can simply copy/paste into a text editor. From there, you can edit, verify, and modify the quiz as needed before uploading the text file to my web app for conversion. As before, download the .zip and import into Canvas. Quiz created, minus the hassle!

Warning

ChatGPT and other generative AI are just tools. They are NOT experts and don’t reason like humans. It is your responsibility to ensure the quality and accuracy of assessments. Never take generated questions and directly use them with students without due diligence.

Prerequisites

  • A list of topics you want covered in your assessment.
  • Access to ChatGPT.
  • A Canvas LMS account.

Step-by-Step Walkthrough

Generating Test Questions with ChatGPT

  1. Introduction to ChatGPT: ChatGPT is a state-of-the-art AI language model. It can help generate questions based on a specific prompt.
  2. Using the Prompt: Provide ChatGPT with the prompt designed to generate questions for an undergraduate biology quiz. (See the optimized prompt provided earlier for reference.)
  3. Formatting and Refining: Once the questions are generated, ensure they meet the format as described in the style guide.

Converting Questions to qti.zip Format using Streamlit App

  1. Introduction to the Streamlit App: This app, based on the text2qti library, will convert the markdown formatted questions into a qti.zip file compatible with Canvas LMS.
  2. Inputting Questions: Copy and paste your questions into the app.
  3. Generating qti.zip File: Follow the app’s instructions to generate the file.

Link to the Streamlit App

Uploading the qti.zip File to Canvas LMS

  1. Log in to your Canvas LMS account.
  2. Navigate to the course where you want to upload the quiz.
  3. Go to the ‘Quizzes’ section and select ‘Import’.
  4. Choose the qti.zip file and upload.

Embedding the YouTube Video

For a more detailed visual walkthrough, watch the tutorial video below:

Conclusion

Harnessing the power of AI, this method simplifies and elevates the quiz-making process. By integrating ChatGPT with the Streamlit app, university professors can efficiently create and upload quizzes to Canvas LMS. We encourage you to try this method and appreciate any feedback.

Additional Resources

  • ChatGPT Official Documentation
  • Streamlit Documentation
  • Canvas LMS Help Center
